thread.title: Tom Bradshaw salutes Saddlers starlets

title: Tom Bradshaw salutes Saddlers starlets
text:
Tweet 
Craig MacGillivray, Liam Kinsella, Rico Henry, Reece Flanagan and substitute Matt Preston all played their part in Saturday’s 2-0 victory over Burton – a result which saw the Saddlers move back to the top of League One. 
Of those players, it was Kinsella who grabbed the headlines with an outstanding performance at right wing-back which also saw the 19-year-old score his first senior goal. 
But Bradshaw has been impressed with Walsall’s entire batch of emerging stars which also includes winger Kieron Morris. 
“I think we’ve got a great batch of youngsters at the club who aren’t fazed at all,” Bradshaw said. 
“I’ve seen a lot of people who have got the ability but, maybe, coming into the first team squad has fazed them. 
“Rico, Liam and Reece all seem to come in, step up to the mark and put in performances week in, week out.” 
“And we need them. The gaffer said at the start of the season it’s not just an 18-man squad. Everyone at the club is going to have to play their part if we want to achieve our ambition of promotion.” 
Bradshaw felt it was no surprise to see Kinsella step into the side and shine in an unfamiliar wing-back role. 
And now he believes boss Dean Smith has a tough decision to make with Jason Demetriou having returned from international duty. 
“Everyone at the club knows what ‘Kins’ can do,” added Bradshaw. 
“He came in last year and did a brilliant job. More on this story:
